title: Natalie Portman talks about her friendship with Britney Spears
text:
Natalie Portman opened up about becoming friends with Britney Spears after the pair shared the first same job as children.

The actress, 38, revealed they both understudied for the same role as kids, and reunited at age 18 to throw a party together.

'Very coincidentally were understudies for the same show when we were kids, so we both were like child actresses,' she said on Tuesday's episode of A Little Late With Lilly Singh.

'She was really great': Natalie Portman opened up about becoming friends with Britney Spears after the pair shared the first same job as children (pictured 2002 in New York City)

'She understudied and then she got the part in the Mickey Mouse Club, she left and I took over for her.'

Though their career paths followed wildly different trajectories, the pair reunited in their late teens to host a New Year's Eve party together.

At the party, the pair talked about their unusual connection.

'And so then when we were like 18, and both of us had had different careers, she obviously became a pop icon and I was acting, and then we met up again and we were like, "We both had the same first job!" It's wild. And we had a party together, and she was really great.'

'We both had the same first job!' Portman revealed she and Britney both understudied for the same role as kids

'We had a party together: The Thor actress hosted a New Year's Eve party with Britney in 2002

Photos from the party capture Natalie and Britney getting along famously as they rang in 2003 together in New York City.

As fate would have it, their stars would continue to grow over the years.

After getting her start on the Mickey Mouse Club, Britney became a household name as she continued to release hit after hit over the years.

Same but different: The ladies both became super stars in their respective fields

Gal pals! Photos from the party capture Natalie and Britney getting along famously as they rang in 2003 together in New York City

The year after ringing in 2003 with Natalie, Britney won her very first Grammy award for Toxic.

Natalie enjoyed equal amounts of success in her acting career.

The Harvard educated actress received an Academy Award in 2010 for her role in the psychological horror film Black Swan.
